intro: Asarum curvistigma, commonly known as the curved-stigma wild ginger, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, hooded flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-brown fruits that contain kidney-shaped seeds. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
